paragraphs: The Prague wildlife rescue station has invited everyone interested to observe how veterinarians will release back into their natural habitat the grown and strengthened hedgehogs who, for various reasons, were left without a mother at birth.
The symbolic ceremony will take place on Tuesday, September 16th, at 5:30 PM.
The meeting point for participants is in front of the main building of the station at Mezi Rolemi 1064, Prague 5 (see on the map).
In addition, from 5:00 PM to 5:30 PM, participants will be able to go up to the green roof of the station for free, from which a panoramic view of the surroundings opens up.
Hedgehogs are the most numerous patients among mammals. This year, the station has already admitted over 450 hedgehogs.
